intro: Corydalis speciosa var. ramosissima, commonly known as the fragrant corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves, which contribute to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its blooming period usually occurs in spring, adding a touch of color to its natural habitat.
